# Amos Chapter 1

  1. The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Tekoa, which he checked out concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah ruler of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash ruler of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

  9. Thus says Yahweh: “For three transgressions of Tyre, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; cuz they delivered up the whole community to Edom, and didn’t remember the brotherly God's promise;
 10. but I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre, and it will devour its palaces.”
 11. Thus says Yahweh: “For three transgressions of Edom, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; cuz he pursued his brother with the sword, and cast off all pity, and his anger raged continually, and he kept his wrath forever;
 12. but I will send a fire on Teman, and it will devour the palaces of Bozrah.”
 13. Thus says Yahweh: “For three transgressions of the children of Ammon, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; cuz they have ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead, that they may enlarge their border.

DANIEL
------

# Daniel Chapter 1

  1. In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim ruler of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar ruler of Babylon to Jerusalem, and besieged it.
  2. The boss gave Jehoiakim ruler of Judah into his hand, with part of the vessels of the house of God; and he carried them into the land of Shinar to the house of his god: and he brought the vessels into the treasure house of his god.
  3. The ruler spoke to Ashpenaz the boss of his eunuchs, that he should bring in certain of the children of Israel, even of the seed royal and of the nobles;
  4. youths in whom was no blemish, but well-favored, and skillful in all wisdom, and endowed with knowledge, and understanding science, and such as had ability to stand in the ruler’s palace; and that he should drop knowledge them the learning and the language of the Chaldeans.
  5. The ruler appointed for them a daily portion of the ruler’s dainties, and of the wine which he drank, and that they should be nourished three years; that at its end they should stand before the ruler.
  6. now among these were, of the children of Judah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
  7. The prince of the eunuchs gave names to them: to Daniel he gave the name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abednego.
  8. But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the ruler’s dainties, nor with the wine which he drank: so basically he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.
  9. now God made Daniel to find kindness and compassion in the sight of the prince of the eunuchs.
 10. The prince of the eunuchs said to Daniel, I fear my boss the ruler, who has appointed your food and your drink: for why should he check it out your faces worse looking than the youths who are of your own age? so would you endanger my head with the ruler.
 11. then Daniel said to the steward whom the prince of the eunuchs had appointed over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah:
 12. Test your servants, I beg you, ten days; and let them hook it up us vegetables to eat, and water to drink.
 13. then let our faces be looked on before you, and the face of the youths who eat of the ruler’s dainties; and as you check it out, deal with your servants.
 14. So he listened to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.
 15. At the end of ten days their faces appeared fairer, and they were fatter in flesh, than all the youths who ate of the ruler’s dainties.
 16. So the steward took away their dainties, and the wine that they should drink, and gave them pulse.
 17. now as for these four youths, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom: and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.
 18. At the end of the days which the ruler had appointed for bringing them in, the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.
 19. The ruler talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: so basically stood they before the ruler.
 20. In every matter of wisdom and understanding, concerning which the ruler inquired of them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and enchanters who were in all his realm.
 21. Daniel continued even to the first year of ruler Cyrus.

# Daniel Chapter 2

  1. In the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams; and his spirit was troubled, and his sleep went from him.

  4. then spoke the Chaldeans to the ruler in the Syrian language, O ruler, live forever: tell your servants the dream, and we will show the interpretation.
  5. The ruler answered the Chaldeans, The thing is gone from me: if you don’t create known to me the dream and its interpretation, you shall be cut in pieces, and your houses shall be made a dunghill.

 10. The Chaldeans answered before the ruler, and said, there is not a man on the earth who can show the ruler’s matter, cuz no ruler, boss, or ruler, has asked such a thing of any magician, or enchanter, or Chaldean.
 11. It is a rare thing that the ruler requires, and there is no other who can show it before the ruler, except the gods, whose dwelling is not with flesh.
 12. For this cause the ruler was mad salty and hella furious, and commanded to tear down all the smart men of Babylon.
 13. So the decree went forth, and the smart men were to be slain; and they sought Daniel and his companions to be slain.
 14. then Daniel returned answer with counsel and prudence to Arioch the captain of the ruler’s guard, who was gone forth to kill the smart men of Babylon;
 15. he answered Arioch the ruler’s captain, Why is the decree so urgent from the ruler? then Arioch made the thing known to Daniel.
 16. Daniel went in, and desired of the ruler that he would appoint him a time, and he would show the ruler the interpretation.
 17. then Daniel went to his house, and made the thing known to Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, his companions:
 18. that they would desire mercies of the God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his companions should not perish with the rest of the smart men of Babylon.
 19. then was the secret revealed to Daniel in a vision of the night. then Daniel blessed up the God of heaven.
 20. Daniel answered, blessed up be the name of God forever and ever; for wisdom and might are his.
 21. He changes the times and the seasons; he removes kings, and sets up kings; he gives wisdom to the smart, and knowledge to those who have understanding;
 22. he reveals the deep and secret things; he knows what is in the darkness, and the light dwells with him.
 23. I thank you, and praise you, you God of my fathers, who have given me wisdom and might, and have now made known to me what we desired of you; for you have made known to us the ruler’s matter.
 24. so basically Daniel went in to Arioch, whom the ruler had appointed to tear down the smart men of Babylon; he went and said thus to him: Don’t tear down the smart men of Babylon; bring me in before the ruler, and I will show to the ruler the interpretation.
 25. then Arioch brought in Daniel before the ruler in haste, and said thus to him, I have found a man of the children of the captivity of Judah, who will create known to the ruler the interpretation.
 26. The ruler answered Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, Are you able to create known to me the dream which I have seen, and its interpretation?
 27. Daniel answered before the ruler, and said, The secret which the ruler has demanded can neither smart men, enchanters, magicians, nor soothsayers, show to the ruler;
 28. but there is a God in heaven who reveals secrets, and he has made known to the ruler Nebuchadnezzar what shall be in the latter days. Your dream, and the visions of your head on your bed, are these:
 29. as for you, O ruler, your thoughts came into your mind on your bed, what should happen hereafter; and he who reveals secrets has made known to you what shall happen.
 30. But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for any wisdom that I have more than any living, but to the intent that the interpretation may be made known to the ruler, and that you may get it the thoughts of your heart.
 31. You, O ruler, checked out, and check this out, a major image. This image, which was mighty, and whose brightness was excellent, stood before you; and its aspect was awesome.
 32. As for this image, its head was of fine gold, its breast and its arms of silver, its belly and its thighs of brass,
 33. its legs of iron, its feet part of iron, and part of clay.
 34. You checked out until a stone was cut out without hands, which struck the image on its feet that were of iron and clay, and broke them in pieces.
 35. then was the iron, the clay, the brass, the silver, and the gold, broken in pieces together, and became like the chaff of the summer threshing floors; and the wind carried them away, so that no place was found for them: and the stone that struck the image became a major mountain, and filled the whole earth.
 36. This is the dream; and we will tell its interpretation before the ruler.
 37. You, O ruler, are ruler of kings, to whom the God of heaven has given the God's squad, the power, and the strength, and the glory;
 38. and wherever the children of men dwell, the animals of the field and the birds of the sky has he given into your hand, and has made you to rule over them all: you are the head of gold.
 39. After you shall arise another God's squad inferior to you; and another third God's squad of brass, which shall bear rule over all the earth.
 40. The fourth God's squad shall be built different as iron, cuz iron breaks in pieces and subdues all things; and as iron that crushes all these, shall it break in pieces and crush.
 41. Whereas you checked out the feet and toes, part of potters’ clay, and part of iron, it shall be a divided God's squad; but there shall be in it of the strength of the iron, cuz you checked out the iron mixed with miry clay.
 42. As the toes of the feet were part of iron, and part of clay, so the God's squad shall be partly built different, and partly broken.
 43. Whereas you checked out the iron mixed with miry clay, they shall mingle themselves with the seed of men; but they shall not cling to one another, even as iron does not mingle with clay.
 44. In the days of those kings shall the God of heaven set up a God's squad which shall never be destroyed, nor shall its sovereignty be left to another people; but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand forever.
 45. cuz you checked out that a stone was cut out of the mountain without hands, and that it broke in pieces the iron, the brass, the clay, the silver, and the gold; the major God has made known to the ruler what shall happen hereafter: and the dream is certain, and its interpretation sure.
 46. then the ruler Nebuchadnezzar fell on his face, and worshiped Daniel, and commanded that they should offer an giving to God and sweet odors to him.
 47. The ruler answered to Daniel, and said, Of a truth your God is the God of gods, and the boss of kings, and a revealer of secrets, since you have been able to reveal this secret.
 48. then the ruler made Daniel major, and gave him a lot major gifts, and made him to rule over the whole province of Babylon, and to be chief governor over all the smart men of Babylon.
 49. Daniel requested of the ruler, and he appointed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, over the affairs of the province of Babylon: but Daniel was in the gate of the ruler.

# Daniel Chapter 3

  1. Nebuchadnezzar the ruler made an image of gold, whose height was sixty cubits, and its breadth six cubits: he set it up in the plain of Dura, in the province of Babylon.
  2. then Nebuchadnezzar the ruler sent to gather together the satraps, the deputies, and the governors, the judges, the treasurers, the counselors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, to come through to the dedication of the image which Nebuchadnezzar the ruler had set up.
  3. then the satraps, the deputies, and the governors, the judges, the treasurers, the counselors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, were gathered together to the dedication of the image that Nebuchadnezzar the ruler had set up; and they stood before the image that Nebuchadnezzar had set up.
  4. then the herald cried aloud, To you it is commanded, peoples, nations, and languages,
  5. that whenever you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music, you fall down and giving props the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the ruler has set up;
  6. and whoever doesn’t fall down and giving props shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
  7. so basically at that time, when all the peoples heard the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music, all the peoples, the nations, and the languages, fell down and worshiped the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the ruler had set up.
  8. so basically at that time certain Chaldeans came near, and brought accusation against the Jews.
  9. They answered Nebuchadnezzar the ruler, O ruler, live for ever.
 10. You, O ruler, have made a decree, that every man that shall hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music, shall fall down and giving props the golden image;
 11. and whoever doesn’t fall down and giving props shall be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
 12. there are certain Jews whom you have appointed over the affairs of the province of Babylon: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego; these men, O ruler, have not respected you. They don’t help out your gods, nor giving props the golden image which you have set up.
 13. then Nebuchadnezzar in his rage and fury commanded to bring Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. then they brought these men before the ruler.
 14. Nebuchadnezzar answered them, Is it on purpose, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, that you don’t help out my god, nor giving props the golden image which I have set up?
 15. now if you are ready whenever you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music to fall down and giving props the image which I have made, well: but if you don’t giving props, you shall be cast the same hour into the midst of a burning fiery furnace; and who is that god that shall deliver you out of my hands?
 16. Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego answered the ruler, Nebuchadnezzar, we have no need to answer you in this matter.
 17. If it be so, our God whom we help out is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace; and he will deliver us out of your hand, O ruler.
 18. But if not, be it known to you, O ruler, that we will not help out your gods, nor giving props the golden image which you have set up.
 19. then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and the form of his appearance was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego: so basically he spoke, and commanded that they should heat the furnace seven times more than it was usually heated.
 20. He commanded certain mighty men who were in his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, and to cast them into the burning fiery furnace.
 21. then these men were bound in their pants, their tunics, and their mantles, and their other garments, and were cast into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.
 22. so basically cuz the ruler’s commandment was urgent, and the furnace exceeding hot, the flame of the fire killed those men who took up Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego.
 23. These three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell down bound into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.
 24. then Nebuchadnezzar the ruler was astonished, and rose up in haste: he spoke and said to his counselors, Didn’t we cast three men bound into the midst of the fire? They answered the ruler, True, O ruler.
 25. He answered, Look, I check it out four men loose, walking in the midst of the fire, and they are unharmed; and the aspect of the fourth is like a son of the gods.
 26. then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace: he spoke and said, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, you servants of the Most High God, come through forth, and come through here. then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego came forth out of the midst of the fire.
 27. The satraps, the deputies, and the governors, and the ruler’s counselors, being gathered together, checked out these men, that the fire had no power on their bodies, nor was the hair of their head singed, neither were their pants changed, nor had the smell of fire passed on them.
 28. Nebuchadnezzar spoke and said, blessed up be the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, who has sent his angel, and delivered his servants who trusted in him, and have changed the ruler’s word, and have yielded their bodies, that they might not help out nor giving props any god, except their own God.
 29. so basically I create a decree, that every people, nation, and language, which spill the tea anything evil against the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, shall be cut in pieces, and their houses shall be made a dunghill; cuz there is no other god who is able to deliver after this sort.
 30. then the ruler promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego in the province of Babylon.

# Daniel Chapter 4

  1. Nebuchadnezzar the ruler, to all the peoples, nations, and languages, who dwell in all the earth: Peace be multiplied to you.
  2. It has seemed fire to me to show the signs and wonders that the Most High God has worked toward me.
  3. How major are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his God's squad is an everlasting God's squad, and his dominion is from generation to generation.
  4. I, Nebuchadnezzar, was at rest in my house, and flourishing in my palace.
  5. I checked out a dream which made me scared; and the thoughts on my bed and the visions of my head troubled me.
  6. so basically made I a decree to bring in all the smart men of Babylon before me, that they might create known to me the interpretation of the dream.
  7. then came in the magicians, the enchanters, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers; and I told the dream before them; but they did not create known to me its interpretation.
  8. But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the set apart gods: and I told the dream before him, saying,
  9. Belteshazzar, boss of the magicians, cuz I get it that the spirit of the set apart gods is in you, and no secret troubles you, tell me the visions of my dream that I have seen, and its interpretation.
 10. Thus were the visions of my head on my bed: I checked out, and check this out, a tree in the midst of the earth; and its height was major.
 11. The tree grew, and was built different, and its height reached to the sky, and its sight to the end of all the earth.
 12. The leaves of it were snatched, and its fruit much, and in it was food for all: the animals of the field had shadow under it, and the birds of the sky lived in its branches, and all flesh was fed from it.
 13. I checked out in the visions of my head on my bed, and check this out, a watcher and a set apart one came down from the sky.
 14. He cried aloud, and said thus, Cut down the tree, and cut off its branches, shake off its leaves, and scatter its fruit: let the animals get away from under it, and the fowls from its branches.
 15. Nevertheless leave the stump of its roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of the sky: and let his portion be with the animals in the grass of the earth:
 16. let his heart be changed from man’s, and let an animal’s heart be given to him; and let seven times pass over him.
 17. The sentence is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the set apart ones; to the intent that the living may get it that the Most High rules in the God's squad of men, and gives it to whomever he will, and sets up over it the lowest of men.
 18. This dream I, ruler Nebuchadnezzar, have seen; and you, Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation, cuz all the smart men of my God's squad are not able to create known to me the interpretation; but you are able; for the spirit of the set apart gods is in you.
 19. then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was stricken mute for a while, and his thoughts troubled him. The ruler answered, Belteshazzar, don’t let the dream, or the interpretation, trouble you. Belteshazzar answered, My boss, the dream be to those who can't stand you, and its interpretation to your adversaries.
 20. The tree that you checked out, which grew, and was built different, whose height reached to the sky, and its sight to all the earth;
 21. whose leaves were snatched, and its fruit much, and in it was food for all; under which the animals of the field lived, and on whose branches the birds of the sky had their habitation:
 22. it is you, O ruler, that are grown and become built different; for your greatness is grown, and reaches to the sky, and your dominion to the end of the earth.
 23. Whereas the ruler checked out a watcher and a set apart one coming down from the sky, and saying, Cut down the tree, and tear down it; nevertheless leave the stump of its roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field, and let it be wet with the dew of the sky: and let his portion be with the animals of the field, until seven times pass over him;
 24. this is the interpretation, O ruler, and it is the decree of the Most High, which has come through on my boss the ruler:
 25. that you shall be driven from men, and your dwelling shall be with the animals of the field, and you shall be made to eat grass as oxen, and shall be wet with the dew of the sky, and seven times shall pass over you; until you get it that the Most High rules in the God's squad of men, and gives it to whomever he will.
 26. Whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the roots of the tree; your God's squad shall be sure to you, after that you shall have known that the heavens do rule.
 27. so basically, O ruler, let my counsel be acceptable to you, and break off your sins by righteousness, and your iniquities by showing mercy to the broke; if there may be a lengthening of your tranquility.
 28. All this came on the ruler Nebuchadnezzar.
 29. At the end of twelve months he was walking in the royal palace of Babylon.
 30. The ruler spoke and said, Is not this major Babylon, which I have built for the royal dwelling place, by the might of my power and for the glory of my majesty?
 31. While the word was in the ruler’s mouth, there fell a voice from the sky, saying, O ruler Nebuchadnezzar, to you it is spoken: The God's squad has departed from you:
 32. and you shall be driven from men; and your dwelling shall be with the animals of the field; you shall be made to eat grass as oxen; and seven times shall pass over you; until you get it that the Most High rules in the God's squad of men, and gives it to whomever he will.
 33. The same hour was the thing fulfilled on Nebuchadnezzar: and he was driven from men, and ate grass as oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of the sky, until his hair was grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws.
 34. At the end of the days I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me, and I blessed up the Most High, and I praised and honored him who lives forever; for his dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his God's squad from generation to generation.
 35. All the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing; and he does according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth; and none can stay his hand, or ask him, What are you doing?
 36. At the same time my understanding returned to me; and for the glory of my God's squad, my majesty and brightness returned to me; and my counselors and my lords sought to me; and I was established in my God's squad, and excellent greatness was added to me.
 37. now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise and extol and honor the ruler of heaven; for all his works are truth, and his ways justice; and those who walk in pride he is able to abase.

# Daniel Chapter 5

  1. Belshazzar the ruler made a major feast to a thousand of his lords, and drank wine before the thousand.
  2. Belshazzar, while he tasted the wine, commanded to bring the golden and silver vessels which Nebuchadnezzar his father had taken out of the God's house which was in Jerusalem; that the ruler and his lords, his wives and his concubines, might drink from them.
  3. then they brought the golden vessels that were taken out of the God's house of the house of God which was at Jerusalem; and the ruler and his lords, his wives and his concubines, drank from them.
  4. They drank wine, and praised the gods of gold, and of silver, of brass, of iron, of wood, and of stone.
  5. In the same hour came forth the fingers of a man’s hand, and wrote over against the lampstand on the plaster of the wall of the ruler’s palace: and the ruler checked out the part of the hand that wrote.
  6. then the ruler’s face was changed in him, and his thoughts troubled him; and the joints of his thighs were loosened, and his knees struck one against another.
  7. The ruler cried aloud to bring in the enchanters, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers. The ruler spoke and said to the smart men of Babylon, Whoever shall read this writing, and show me its interpretation, shall be clothed with purple, and have a chain of gold about his neck, and shall be the third ruler in the God's squad.
  8. then came in all the ruler’s smart men; but they could not read the writing, nor create known to the ruler the interpretation.
  9. then was ruler Belshazzar greatly troubled, and his face was changed in him, and his lords were perplexed.
 10. now the ruler by reason of the words of the ruler and his lords came into the banquet house: the ruler spoke and said, O ruler, live forever; don’t let your thoughts trouble you, nor let your face be changed.
 11. there is a man in your God's squad, in whom is the spirit of the set apart gods; and in the days of your father light and understanding and wisdom, like the wisdom of the gods, were found in him; and the ruler Nebuchadnezzar your father, the ruler, I say, your father, made him boss of the magicians, enchanters, Chaldeans, and soothsayers;
 12. cuz an excellent spirit, and knowledge, and understanding, interpreting of dreams, and showing of dark sentences, and dissolving of doubts, were found in the same Daniel, whom the ruler named Belteshazzar. now let Daniel be called, and he will show the interpretation.
 13. then was Daniel brought in before the ruler. The ruler spoke and said to Daniel, Are you that Daniel, who are of the children of the captivity of Judah, whom the ruler my father brought out of Judah?
 14. I have heard of you, that the spirit of the gods is in you, and that light and understanding and excellent wisdom are found in you.
 15. now the smart men, the enchanters, have been brought in before me, that they should read this writing, and create known to me its interpretation; but they could not show the interpretation of the thing.
 16. But I have heard of you, that you can hook it up interpretations, and dissolve doubts; now if you can read the writing, and create known to me its interpretation, you shall be clothed with purple, and have a chain of gold about your neck, and shall be the third ruler in the God's squad.
 17. then Daniel answered before the ruler, Let your gifts be to yourself, and hook it up your rewards to another; nevertheless I will read the writing to the ruler, and create known to him the interpretation.
 18. You, ruler, the Most High God gave Nebuchadnezzar your father the God's squad, and greatness, and glory, and majesty:
 19. and cuz of the greatness that he gave him, all the peoples, nations, and languages trembled and feared before him: whom he would he killed, and whom he would he kept alive; and whom he would he raised up, and whom he would he put down.
 20. But when his heart was lifted up, and his spirit was hardened so that he dealt proudly, he was deposed from his kingly throne, and they took his glory from him:
 21. and he was driven from the sons of men, and his heart was made like the animals’, and his dwelling was with the wild donkeys; he was fed with grass like oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of the sky; until he knew that the Most High God rules in the God's squad of men, and that he sets up over it whomever he will.
 22. You, his son, Belshazzar, have not humbled your heart, though you knew all this,
 23. but have lifted up yourself against the boss of heaven; and they have brought the vessels of his house before you, and you and your lords, your wives and your concubines, have drunk wine from them; and you have praised the gods of silver and gold, of brass, iron, wood, and stone, which don’t check it out, nor hear, nor get it; and the God in whose hand your breath is, and whose are all your ways, you have not glorified.
 24. then was the part of the hand sent from before him, and this writing was inscribed.
 25. This is the writing that was inscribed: MENE, MENE, TEKEL, UPHARSIN.
 26. This is the interpretation of the thing: MENE; God has numbered your God's squad, and brought it to an end;
 27. TEKEL; you are weighed in the balances, and are found wanting.
 28. PERES; your God's squad is divided, and given to the Medes and Persians.
 29. then commanded Belshazzar, and they clothed Daniel with purple, and put a chain of gold about his neck, and made proclamation concerning him, that he should be the third ruler in the God's squad.
 30. In that night Belshazzar the Chaldean ruler was slain.
 31. Darius the Mede received the God's squad, being about sixty-two years old.

# Daniel Chapter 6

  1. It pleased Darius to set over the God's squad one hundred twenty satraps, who should be throughout the whole God's squad;
  2. and over them three presidents, of whom Daniel was one; that these satraps might hook it up account to them, and that the ruler should have no damage.
  3. then this Daniel was distinguished above the presidents and the satraps, cuz an excellent spirit was in him; and the ruler thought to set him over the whole realm.
  4. then the presidents and the satraps sought to find occasion against Daniel as touching the God's squad; but they could find no occasion nor fault, cuz he was faithful, neither was there any error or fault found in him.
  5. then these men said, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning the law of his God.
  6. then these presidents and satraps assembled together to the ruler, and said thus to him, ruler Darius, live forever.
  7. All the presidents of the God's squad, the deputies and the satraps, the counselors and the governors, have consulted together to establish a royal statute, and to create a built different decree, that whoever shall ask a petition of any god or man for thirty days, except of you, O ruler, he shall be cast into the den of lions.
  8. now, O ruler, establish the decree, and sign the writing, that it not be changed, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which doesn’t alter.
  9. so basically ruler Darius signed the writing and the decree.
 10. When Daniel knew that the writing was signed, he went into his house (now his windows were open in his room toward Jerusalem) and he kneeled on his knees three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks before his God, as he did before.
 11. then these men assembled together, and found Daniel making petition and supplication before his God.
 12. then they came near, and spoke before the ruler concerning the ruler’s decree: Haven’t you signed an decree, that every man who shall create petition to any god or man within thirty days, except to you, O ruler, shall be cast into the den of lions? The ruler answered, The thing is true, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which doesn’t alter.
 13. then answered they and said before the ruler, That Daniel, who is of the children of the captivity of Judah, doesn’t respect you, O ruler, nor the decree that you have signed, but makes his petition three times a day.
 14. then the ruler, when he heard these words, was hella displeased, and set his heart on Daniel to deliver him; and he labored until the going down of the sun to rescue him.
 15. then these men assembled together to the ruler, and said to the ruler, get it, O ruler, that it is a law of the Medes and Persians, that no decree nor statute which the ruler establishes may be changed.
 16. then the ruler commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into the den of lions. now the ruler spoke and said to Daniel, Your God whom you help out continually, he will deliver you.
 17. A stone was brought, and laid on the mouth of the den; and the ruler sealed it with his own signet, and with the signet of his lords; that nothing might be changed concerning Daniel.
 18. then the ruler went to his palace, and passed the night fasting; neither were instruments of music brought before him: and his sleep fled from him.
 19. then the ruler arose hella early in the morning, and went in haste to the den of lions.
 20. When he came near to the den to Daniel, he cried with a lamentable voice; the ruler spoke and said to Daniel, Daniel, helper of the living God, is your God, whom you help out continually, able to deliver you from the lions?
 21. then Daniel said to the ruler, O ruler, live forever.
 22. My God has sent his angel, and has shut the lions’ mouths, and they have not hurt me; cuz as before him innocence was found in me; and also before you, O ruler, have I done no hurt.
 23. then was the ruler exceeding glad, and commanded that they should grab Daniel up out of the den. So Daniel was taken up out of the den, and no kind of harm was found on him, cuz he had trusted in his God.
 24. The ruler commanded, and they brought those men who had accused Daniel, and they cast them into the den of lions, them, their children, and their wives; and the lions mauled them, and broke all their bones in pieces, before they came to the bottom of the den.
 25. then ruler Darius wrote to all the peoples, nations, and languages, who dwell in all the earth: Peace be multiplied to you.
 26. I create a decree, that in all the dominion of my God's squad men tremble and fear before the God of Daniel; for he is the living God, and steadfast forever, His God's squad that which shall not be destroyed; and his dominion shall be even to the end.
 27. He delivers and rescues, and he works signs and wonders in heaven and in earth, who has delivered Daniel from the power of the lions.
 28. So this Daniel prospered in the reign of Darius, and in the reign of Cyrus the Persian.

# Daniel Chapter 7

  1. In the first year of Belshazzar ruler of Babylon Daniel had a dream and visions of his head on his bed: then he wrote the dream and told the sum of the matters.
  2. Daniel spoke and said, I checked out in my vision by night, and, check this out, the four winds of the sky broke forth on the major sea.
  3. Four major animals came up from the sea, diverse one from another.
  4. The first was like a lion, and had eagle’s wings: I checked out until its wings were plucked, and it was lifted up from the earth, and made to stand on two feet as a man; and a man’s heart was given to it.
  5. check this out, another animal, a second, like a bear; and it was raised up on one side, and three ribs were in its mouth between its teeth: and they said thus to it, Arise, devour much flesh.
  6. After this I checked out, and check this out, another, like a leopard, which had on its back four wings of a bird; the animal had also four heads; and dominion was given to it.
  7. After this I checked out in the night visions, and, check this out, a fourth animal, awesome and powerful, and built different exceedingly; and it had major iron teeth; it devoured and broke in pieces, and stamped the residue with its feet: and it was diverse from all the animals that were before it; and it had ten horns.
  8. I considered the horns, and check this out, there came up among them another horn, a little one, before which three of the first horns were plucked up by the roots: and check this out, in this horn were eyes like the eyes of a man, and a mouth speaking major things.
  9. I checked out until thrones were placed, and one who was ancient of days sat: his clothing was white as snow, and the hair of his head like pure wool; his throne was fiery flames, and its wheels burning fire.
 10. A fiery stream issued and came forth from before him: thousands of thousands ministered to him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before him: the judgment was set, and the books were opened.
 11. I checked out at that time cuz of the voice of the major words which the horn spoke; I checked out even until the animal was slain, and its body destroyed, and it was given to be burned with fire.
 12. As for the rest of the animals, their dominion was taken away: yet their lives were prolonged for a season and a time.
 13. I checked out in the night visions, and check this out, there came with the clouds of the sky one like a son of man, and he came even to the ancient of days, and they brought him near before him.
 14. there was given him dominion, and glory, and a God's squad, that all the peoples, nations, and languages should help out him: his dominion is an everlasting dominion, which shall not pass away, and his God's squad that which shall not be destroyed.
 15. As for me, Daniel, my spirit was grieved in the midst of my body, and the visions of my head troubled me.
 16. I came near to one of those who stood by, and asked him the truth concerning all this. So he told me, and made me get it the interpretation of the things.
 17. These major animals, which are four, are four kings, who shall arise out of the earth.

# Deuteronomy Chapter 1

# Deuteronomy Chapter 12

  1. These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess it, all the days that you live on the earth.
  2. You shall surely tear down all the places in which the nations that you shall dispossess served their gods, on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every green tree:
  3. and you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and burn their Asherim with fire; and you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods; and you shall tear down their name out of that place.

  5. But to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, even to his habitation you shall seek, and there you shall come through;
  6. and there you shall bring your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and the wave giving to God of your hand, and your vows, and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock:

 15. Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat flesh within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God which he has given you: the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle, and as of the hart.
 16. Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.
 17. You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your new wine, or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, nor any of your vows which you vow, nor your freewill offerings, nor the wave giving to God of your hand;

 22. Even as the gazelle and as the hart is eaten, so you shall eat of it: the unclean and the clean may eat of it alike.
 23. Only be sure that you don’t eat the blood: for the blood is the life; and you shall not eat the life with the flesh.
 24. You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.

 26. Only your set apart things which you have, and your vows, you shall grab, and slide to the place which Yahweh shall choose:
